importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the public was informed about the incident and the NTSB report.
The date of the plane crash, which is central to the timeline and context of the incident.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred on September 18, 2025, marking the exact date of the crash, which is the focal point of the report.

keyTakeAways: A plane piloted by Grammy-winning songwriter Brett James crashed in Franklin, North Carolina, on September 18, 2025, killing all three people on board.
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the aircraft entered a 'tightening spiral' during its approach to runway 7.
Brett James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which was approved by air traffic control, but failed to change to the common traffic advisory frequency, leading to a loss of communication.
The plane, a Cirrus SR22T, flew over the runway, executed a left turn, and descended before spiraling and crashing.
No mechanical issues were found in the wreckage, indicating the crash was likely due to pilot or communication error.

Brett James was a prominent songwriter who collaborated with major artists such as Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, notably co-writing 'Out Last Night' and 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' for Carrie Underwood.
The incident raises concerns about communication protocols in aviation, especially when pilots fail to adjust radio frequencies during approach procedures.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Aviation communication frequency used by pilots when no air traffic control is present
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The failure to switch to CTAF is a key factor in the crash, illustrating a procedural error that led to loss of communication.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The plane piloted by Grammy-winning songwriter Brett James crashed on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina, killing all three people on board. According to the NTSB's preliminary report, the aircraft entered a 'tightening spiral' during a visual approach to runway 7, following a failure to change to the common traffic advisory frequency, which resulted in a loss of communication with air traffic control. Investigators found no mechanical issues, suggesting the crash was due to a procedural or communication error. Brett James, known for his collaborations with major artists like Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, and Kenny Chesney, was a prominent figure in country music, making this incident both personally and culturally significant.
title: Brett James' Plane Crashes After Communication Failure, NTSB Reports
